message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with coding theory and information theory, specifically exact-repair regenerating codes. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses network coding and storage systems, which could fall under cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Additionally, the paper mentions symmetric optimal solutions, which could relate to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper provides an explicit binary code construction, which could fall under cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
